basics.name: Jiangang Hao, Ph.D.
basics.label: Research Director
basics.summary: Research Director at ETS leading the Assessment of Complex Skills program. Focus on leveraging AI, data analytics, and big data to understand people and interactions.

work.name: Educational Testing Service
work.position: Director, Assessment of Complex Skills Program
work.summary: Led the Assessment of Complex Skills program to develop data analytics and AI-based solutions for complex skills such as collaboration, communication, and social skills in classroom settings.
highlights: Led a community effort to analyze and document how LLMs and generative AI transform assessment.
Developed guidelines and researched new methods for responsible use of detectors of AI-generated texts.

work.name: Educational Testing Service
work.position: Director, Psychometric and Data Science Modeling
work.summary: Led the Psychometric and Data Science Modeling group to innovate data science methods for extracting insights from complex digital learning and assessment data.
highlights: Developed and implemented over seven data analytics and AI solutions to enhance test security, achieving over 60% detection of cheating incidents.
Served on the corporate Test Security Leadership Team to guide strategy for test security in remote testing environments.
Co-edited 'Computational Psychometrics' to integrate data science, machine learning, and NLP with measurement principles.

work.name: Educational Testing Service
work.position: Managing Senior Research Scientist, Assessment Analytics and Data Science
work.summary: Led the Assessment Analytics and Data Science group to develop innovative analytics methods and operational support.
highlights: Architected and led the development of the EPCAL Classroom version and cloud-based data analytics pipelines, supporting over five research projects.
Served on the ETS AI Strategy Committee to contribute to corporate AI strategy development.

work.name: Educational Testing Service
work.position: Senior Research Scientist, Psychometrics, Statistics, and Data Science
work.summary: Co-chaired the Research Advisory Council to lead the Measurement Frontier Research Initiative and developed innovative platforms and methods for assessment.
highlights: Developed the ETS Platform for Collaborative Assessment and Learning (EPCAL), supporting over 13 research projects.
Introduced the Evidence Trace File for virtual performance assessment and process data analysis.

work.name: Educational Testing Service
work.position: Research Scientist, Center for Computational Psychometrics
work.summary: Innovated computational psychometric methods and data models for educational assessments.
highlights: Led the ETS Collaborative Science project, creating assessment tools showcased at the White House by the NCES commissioner.
Developed the ETS data model for virtual performance assessment to capture extensive process data.

work.name: University of Pennsylvania
work.summary: Developed image reduction pipelines and machine learning methods for the Dark Energy Survey.
highlights: Created a machine learning method utilizing image-based shape measurement for real-time feedback on camera alignment.
Enhanced imaging precision for CCD testing in astronomical surveys.

work.name: Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory
work.description: U.S. Department of Energy National Laboratory
work.summary: Developed methods for astronomical data analysis and galaxy clustering.
highlights: Developed image-based methods to measure the flatness of the DECam focal plane.
Created the largest catalog of clustered galaxies using the GMBCG algorithm.

work.name: University of Michigan
work.summary: Conducted research on galaxy clusters and astronomical data using machine learning.
highlights: Developed the GMBCG algorithm to detect galaxy clusters from astronomical data.
Created an error-corrected Gaussian Mixture Model algorithm for precise measurements of galaxy color distributions.
